definition: (coll.) to leave/to beat it
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave
pinyin: pai1 pai1 pi4 gu5 zou3 ren2

definition: to pack one's things and leave

sentences.english: One in three workers will be gone.
sentences.chinese: 三分之一的工人會捲鋪蓋走人。

sentences.english: If they didn't, they were going home.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有，就得捲鋪蓋走人。

sentences.english: If you are late tomorrow, then you will pack yourself off .
sentences.chinese: 如果明天你遲到的話，那麼捲鋪蓋走人。

definition: get out of here!/beat it!
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave
pinyin: pai1 pai1 pi4 gu5 zou3 ren2

definition: to leave
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
to pack and quit/to be sacked
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to leave in stealth/to slip away
to depart/to leave
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to disband/(of a partnership, group etc) to break up
to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly
to remove/to take away/to withdraw
to go home (in a ceremonial procession)/to return home
to travel on foot/(informal) to run off/to abscond
to steal away/to beat it
